cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.DL, cs.LG, cs.DB. 

The paper discusses the evaluation of document similarity models in scholarly information retrieval systems, which is a common topic in the field of information retrieval (IR). Therefore, cs.IR is the most likely sub-category. The paper also mentions the use of topic models, which is a common technique in natural language processing (NLP) and computational linguistics (CL), suggesting cs.CL as the second likely sub-category. The use of deep learning (DL) is also mentioned, which is a popular technique in many sub-fields of computer science, including NLP and computer vision, making cs.DL a likely sub-category. The paper also discusses the use of statistical methods for evaluating the performance of the models, which is a common topic in machine learning (ML) and statistics, suggesting cs.LG as a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper deals with the analysis of user logs, which is a common topic in databases (DB), making cs.DB a possible sub-category.
